PAL.NAME: Microsoft Hyper-V R2 SP1
PAL.DESCRIPTION: General operating system performance analysis for Microsoft Windows Server 2008 and Windows 2008 R2 SP1 with Hyper-V. Use this for a general analysis of the operating system performance counters.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hyper-V Virtual Guest Computer Processor Analysis
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Virtual Processor(*)\% Guest Run Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This analysis checks the processor utilization of guest, virtual computer processors. The "\Hyper-V Hypervisor Virtual Processor(*)\% Guest Run Time" performance counter is more accurate than using the "% Processor Time" counter within the virtual computer due to clock calculation drift.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Virtual Processor(*)\% Guest Run Time
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Virtual Processor(*)\% Guest Run Time

THRESHOLD.NAME: Hyper-V: High processor utilization of more than 75% on a virtual processor
Hyper-V: Very high processor utilization of more than 90% on a virtual processor

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Virtual Processor(*)\% Guest Run Time
CHART.DATASOURCE: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Virtual Processor(*)\% Guest Run Time

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hyper-V Physical Server Processor Analysis
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: This analysis checks the processor utilization of physical processors of the host computer. The "\Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time" performance counter is more accurate than using the "% Processor Time" counter on the host, root partition computer because the "% Processor Time" counter only measures the processor time of the host, root partition computer only. The "\Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time" performance counter is the best counter to use to analyze overall processor utilization of the Hyper-V server.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time

THRESHOLD.NAME: Hyper-V: High processor utilization of more than 75% on a physical processor
Hyper-V: Very high processor utilization of more than 90% on a physical processor

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time
CHART.DATASOURCE: \Hyper-V Hypervisor Logical Processor(*)\% Total Run Time

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hyper-V Physical Server Network Analysis
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
This counter represents the total number of bytes that have traversed the network adapter. Bytes/sec is the rate at which bytes are sent and received over each network adapter both physical and virtual. How quickly you can identify a problem depends on the type of network you have as well as whether you share bandwidth with other applications, services, or virtual computers.

Unlike the Network Interface performance counter object, the connection speed of the virtual network adapters is not exposed as a performance counter, therefore statistics only are provided for this counter. See the Network Interface\Bytes Total/sec alerts to determine if network saturation is occurring on the physical network adapters.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LogicalDisk Disk Transfers/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Disk Transfers/sec is the rate of read and write operations on the disk. This counter is to messure the IOPs your logical disk have done.
A typical 7.200 rpm SATA disk can do ~75-100 IOPs. A typical 10.000 rpm SATA disk can do ~125-150 IOPs. A typical 15.000 rpm SAS disk can do ~175-210 IOPs.

ANALYSIS.NAME: PhysicalDisk Disk Transfers/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Disk Transfers/sec is the rate of read and write operations on the disk. This counter is to messure the IOPs your logical disk have done.
A typical 7.200 rpm SATA disk can do ~75-100 IOPs. A typical 10.000 rpm SATA disk can do ~125-150 IOPs. A typical 15.000 rpm SAS disk can do ~175-210 IOPs.
